newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: F&N to appeal value of land compensation.
newsitem.headline: F&N to appeal value of land compensation.

text.p: Food and beverage group Fraser & Neave (F&N) said on Friday it had appealed for a review of the compensation given for a piece of land.

The Collector of Land Revenue had granted an award of Singapore $181.4 million to Centrepoint Properties Ltd's subsidiary CPL Woodlands Pte Ltd for the compulsory acquisition of a piece of land it owned in Singapore.
Centrepoint Properties is part of the F&N group.

"The company believes that this inadequately reflects the value of the property and an appeal for review of the basis of the award has been lodged," F&N said in a statement accompanying its 1996 results.
It said the book value of the property is S$103.9 million and the gain resulting from the award will be taken up in its accounts when the result of the appeal is known.
